de.jannlab.math

Class Histogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.jannlab.math.Histogram

  • public class Histogram
extends Object
    This class provides the construction of ordinary histograms based on the type double. For setting up a histogram a number of quanta (bins) as well as a lower and an upper bound of the value interval must be given. With the note method a value can be "counted". After all, the histogram can be normalized.

    Author:
    Sebastian Otte

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Histogram(double lbd, double ubd, int quanta)
      Instantiates a Histogram object for given values value range determined by a lower and an upper bound, with a given number a quanta (bins).

        public Histogram(double lbd,
         double ubd,
         int quanta)
        Instantiates a Histogram object for given values value range determined by a lower and an upper bound, with a given number a quanta (bins).

        Parameters:
        lbd - Lower bound of the accumulation interval.
        ubd - Upper bound of the accumulation interval.
        quanta - Number of quanta (bins).

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Resets the current histogram. All accumulated values are set to 0.0.

        Returns:

      • printBars

        public String printBars(int height)
        This method produces a simple bar-chart representation of the inner accumulator as a white-space aligned String. The given height defines the number of text lines of which the highest bar in the histogram may consists of. Note, that the resulting string is just for ascii-style printouts, it should not be used for extracting histogram data.

        Parameters:
        height - The number of lines of the highest bar.
        Returns:
        A string containing the bar-char representation of the histogram.

      • getAccu

        public double[] getAccu()
        Returns the inner accumulator, which contains all histogram values.

        Returns:
        Histogram values as double[].
